name: Le Meridien Chiang Mai

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel over the weekend and it was a pleasant stay. More of a business hotel, strategic location with a night market at the hotel's footsteps, lots of eateries, a night bazaar a few feet away. The rooms are spacious with a really amazingly comfortable bed and pillows. The room I was in faces a mountain range so it was nice waking up to a good view.The bathroom comes with a bath tub and separate shower enclosure with a rain shower head. Tried the hotel's spa's signature treatment Chakra Ritual,which "focuses on the benefits and healing gained through the art of “life force energy” via a modified crystal therapy". Crystals are placed at key energy points while the masseuse continues to massage the head, neck and shoulders. The treatment is complete with a milk bath in a jacuzzi. I would recommend this treatment, however there are others to choose from too such as the normal Thai, swedish massage, pedicure, manicure among others. The staff are pleasant and helpful. Free wifi available in the lobby. A good breakfast spread. Overall a good stay!
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on SPG points after we got separated from our tour. Last-minute booking was difficult, since many of the nights we wanted to stay were sold out.
reviews.title: Comfy beds, western hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were nice (although not quite as nice as the Four Points in Bangkok), and the service was pretty good. The beds were over-the-top soft and comfortable, something hard to find in Thailand. The Le Meridien was a fantastic value when paid with points, especially after upgrading to a club room with breakfast and lounge access. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant (included with club access) was top-notch and had a lot of Thai food in addition to the typical stuff you'd find at a Le Meridien.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: The Le Meridien had a perfect location right across the street from the night bazaar and within walking distance to the old city. It was tall, so you could see it from just about anywhere around.
reviews.title: Brilliant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only real complaint is that this hotel didn't really "fit" with the rest of the city -- it was essentially an island of well-to-do tourists in a tower overlooking a fairly poor section of town. If you stay here, you won't necessarily feel the vibe of the night market or experience interactions with the locals. Instead, you'll live in a sanitized bubble towering above the city.
reviews.title: No need to fly to Thailand to experience this type of hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights using SPG Cash & Points and would consider this value for money. The night bazaar is located merely steps from the hotel with Starbucks, Haagan Dazs, McDonald and Burger King alongside. There is also the local coffee chain - Doi Chang within 100m away. 7-11 stores are also at every turn and corners of the hotel. The hotel is fairly new (less than a year old) and has expensive furnishing, Lobby and all their restaurants are tastefully furnished. Facade of hotel looks impressive as compared to other hotels along Chang Klan road. As you enter into the hotel, the lobby welcomes you grandly.
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel with good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were allocated a room on the 10th floor which has view of the city. Room is of decent size and furnished in whte and beige. It gives a modern look but too "clinical" for my liking albeit with expensive furnishing.
reviews.title: So convenient!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staffs in the hotel are ever so accommodating and welcoming and will provide much help when approached The staff in the reception called a local Thai restaurant to asked for direction (as I do not have the name and address of the restaurant in Thai) for us.He wrote down the name and address in Thai for us to forward to the taxi driver.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, fairly expensive for Chiang Mai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is defintely a good hotel if you are travelling with children due to its strategic location with lots of amenities.
reviews.title: Great hotel with excellent service!

reviews.text: We had a most enjoyable 4 nights at Le Meridien as part of a flight/accommodation package booked through a Travel Agent. I had already checked Trip Advisor and I agree with the majority of reviewers that this is a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect, in the heart of everything, clean and beautiful room
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: We were in town for a wedding and this was my brother's gift to us. He put us up in the newest hotel in town, and too bad he and the bride didn't stay a few nights in the super deluxe suite. LM is modern, geared to the business travel with clean lines, light colors, and a sense of spaciousness. There were days when I really didn't want to see any more of Chiang Mai, the elephants, the shopping districts and the food stalls. I just wanted to schlep around in the room in my comfy bed, watch cable TV, and take showers all day. The gym is small, but totally adequate with free weights; they could turn the air conditioning up a bit though. Likewise the pool area is small, but really quite nice overlooking Doi Suthep in the distance over the infinity pool (and guard rail).
reviews.title: Modern, sorta hip and definitely adjacent to the night market

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had massages every day down the street (like literally, EVERY DAY), and the relatives went shopping EVERY DAY. There was no end to it. Otherwise, the hotel is just well run, and they know customer satisfaction counts. On day 4 there was a weird smell in our room, and they moved us across the hall and sent us a legion of staff to help, then sent us chocolates for the inconvenience. I was also stuck in the elevator at 5AM (to see the monks process at sunrise) and they got me out in 8 minutes. The on duty manager was graciously apologetic and in general, what can you do? At least they were quick.
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.text: LM is in the eastern section (commercial district) outside of the old Walled City and abuts the daily night market. Shopping does get old, but don't forget about the fish spas, massage places, and all the eateries. Super handy. The buffet breakfast is really quite amazing -- big spread, very well done -- and will last you through dinner, almost! Make sure you visit the Sunday market, get your hair washed in the salon, massage EVERY DAY, and just soak it up. One of the most relaxing towns, friendliest towns in the world.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay, if not the area so much
Brandnew comfortable hotel
reviews.text: so close to the airport, unbelievable lobby, rooms, pool,fitness center, location, service,etc. I can't compliment this hotel enough. Your stay here will be a pleasure-- the bed is out of this world! You are in the best possible location.

If you have gluten sensitivity, you need to pick this hotel when you visit Chiang Mai. Their breakfast spread is great but you must try their gluten free bread. They are awesome. The location is right at the night market. So all you have to do is to walk out and shop shop shop. The lobby lounge has great snacks while you use their free WiFi. We enjoyed our stay there very much.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great gluten free bread

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really nice hotel, newly refurbished rooms excellent bathroom, very convenient location and excellent buffet breakfast. Staff efficient and professional, like a business hotel. The Thai atmosphere is right outside the hotel, shops , markets & restaurants etc. Great swimming pool and gym. Free wifi in lobby and executive lounge. Executive lounge awesome. Very good value for money. Would go back.
reviews.title: Chiang Mai at its best

reviews.text: I agree with Jamesinthailand. I have just stayed there for 6 nights and just returned back to my country. I find that this hotel has been over rated. Location is fantastic. Room is nice and bed is very comfortable. But the service and friendliness of the staff has been over rated. The staff are good and efficient but that was expected standard for all international brand hotels. Overwelming? Definately not. Price..very expensive! 2 days' stay equivelent to an average chiangmai worker's monthly wage.
reviews.title: Review of Le Meridien Chiangmai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast is good, but same varieties every day. First 2 days, I enjoyed the breakfast, remaining days..I'm kinda sick of it.
reviews.title: Luxury Western Chain Hotel in Chiang Mai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an ultra modern, luxury chain hotel where if one wants a stay in a cocoon that could be anywhere - New York or Chicago, for example - this is the place for you. But for the Thai staff, efficient, but somewhat impersonal, you would never know you were in Thailand. There is no internet in the rooms, which is unacceptable for a hotel of this caliber. There is free internet for one hour in the lobby and in the gym/pool area on the 4th floor, provided by codes on slips of papers given out by the reception desk. But after the hour expires, one has to obtain a new code or pay. A minor criticism is that the two towels provided for the sumptuous bathroom are puny, in incongruous contrast to the plush large towels in the pool area. The hotel has New York prices for amenities such as the spa and restaurant facilities, which is ridiculous for Thailand. Having said this, the rooms are very comfortable and modern, with the aforesaid wonderful bathroom being a place to spend a lot of time if one were disposed to doing that. The hotel is centrally located in all of the action, next to the night markets. And the large infinity pool on the fourth floor, facing west, with a western view of the surrounding mountains, is splendid, especially at sunset, almost alone a reason to stay at this hotel. However, if one wants a Thai experience, there are quite a few upscale boutique hotels in Chiang Mai where one can more enjoy the sensuous pleasures of Thailand.
reviews.title: Most pleasant stay

reviews.text: Le Meridien Chiang Mai has a wonderful location in the middle of the city. The Night Bazaar is just right outside, though I did not visited it as much as I enjoyed connecting to other more peaceful and beautiful sights around the city.
reviews.title: Sparkling hotel in the middle of Chiang Mai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is shiny and new. I love the modern decor that is indicative of Le Meridien hotels nowadays. It is a nice contrast to some of the traditional resorts in this ancient city.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel....but beware of the tour group vibe.

reviews.text: This is at its core a very efficient hotel. The check in and check out were prompt and professional. The housekeeping was flawless. The restaurant staff was exceptional, especially considering the many tour groups that dine there daily. This may be the best business hotel in northern Thailand.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The rooms were modern, with a fantastic layout of the bathroom. A circular tub sits in the middle under a rain shower. Every corner of the bedroom was carefully thought out. You literally do not have to call for assistance as everything was there within reach.
reviews.title: Good service, so so location

reviews.text: Le Meridien Chiang Mai offers travelers to the city something that is crisp and lively. It is a smooth ride all the way through, a departure from competing hotels nearby that try so hard to have unique characters while forgetting efficiency and warmth.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the Royal Club Floor and the staff were exceptionally attentive and took care of all our bookings and other requirements. We also liked the view from the high floor (Level 21). there are not many tall buildings in Chiang Mai so all rooms have a great view.
reviews.title: Elegant Oasis in the Heart of Chiang Mai

reviews.text: We enjoyed returning each day this hotel after a day of sight seeing and shopping. The hotel staff are very professional and this hotel is truly a relaxing oasis is a bustling city.
reviews.title: Very comfy hotel, just steps away from Night Bazar etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Club included breakfast, high tea and evening cocktails - all were excellent.
reviews.title: Barely four stars

reviews.text: Half way through our stay the neighbour next door was very noisy and the staff relocated us to another room without hesitation even though the hotel was very busy over Christmas.
reviews.title: A service orientated experience

reviews.text: The rooms were very elegant and the bed extremely comfortable. The gym was excellent and the Spa first rate.
reviews.title: Nice room, convenient location

reviews.text: I recently stayed 3 nights in one of the Le Royal Club rooms and was pleased with every aspect of the stay. For a very modest upcharge, Le Royal Club provides greatly enhanced service and I absolutely recommend it. In addition to private check-in and check-out in the club lounge, it provides staffed service from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm, including an excellent breakfast, evening cocktails, computer stations, and all-day beverages. The lounge staff is extremely helpful and quick to learn your name, and the facility is quite spacious and nicely turned out.
reviews.title: Stylish Stay and Perfect Location
Modern hotel in downtown location
reviews.text: While the club level service with a mountain-view room enhanced my stay, I found the spa, gym, and pool to be excellent, and the massage therapists were of top-tier international standards and at a price quite reasonable for the quality of the spa facility.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just as importantly, the entire property was immaculate and the sleep quality was the best of my Thailand trip. Both interior and exterior noise suppression were excellent and the maximum speed of the AC fan also provides both white noise and the ability to keep the room extremely cool in the hot Thai afternoons.
reviews.title: Good location for an average Hotel, lacking any personality...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location makes the hotel an easy walk to the key historic areas inside the moat of the old city and a tuktuk can easily be had for 50 baht if one does not care to walk.
reviews.title: Overall good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I considered the Mandarin Oriental Dhara Devi and the Four Seasons, but both are further from the center, especially the Four Seasons. That said, I did go to dinner at the Mandarin Oriental's Thai restaurant. The food is excellent and music and traditional dance is offered complimentary in the evening on the verandah, making the evening a special experience at an extremely reasonable price.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and location

reviews.text: Le Meridien has managed to create a hotel which perfectly caters for the seasoned business traveler with attentive and friendly service. Nice touches that we commented on was the use of artists and designers to spruce up things which would normally go unnoticed such as room cards and lift music. The rooms were great with good views of Chiang Mai. It is located is right next to the night market.
reviews.title: Just what we were looking for

reviews.text: Would recommend this hands down for those looking to use it as a base for excursions, though not as a resort hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful and Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a new hotel, completed about mid-2007. So everything is modern and works. Coupled with the location, it is a difficult hotel to beat.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is sizeable with a longish sofa that doubled as a single bed. The bathroom is good size with a shower stall and a bathtub. The only gripe with the room is the seeming lack of storage for clothes for three of us. The drawers look good but are shallow.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with great staff and location

reviews.text: The restaurant is good; the spa massage was wonderful. Thanks to competition, the prices are down. There is also an excellent gym, one of the best designed (it's modern) that I have seen in a hotel. It overlooks the pool. Aerobic machines are nearer the door. Weights and mats are further inside so passers by cannot ogle you while you are on the floor.
reviews.title: New hotel, great location.

reviews.text: The Le Meridien Chiang Mai is a wonderful hotel. Urusula, the GM, went out of her way to make us feel welcome. She is a very nice lady; very helpful with planning our itinerary, helpful with our girls eating idiosyncrancies, etc. As a matter of fact, the entire staff was very accomodating. The hotel is super clean, quiet and very safe feeling. An extra bonus is that you walk right out the door and you are at the best night market ever. Save your shopping for Chiang Mai; it beats Bangkok in my opinion. Do yourself a favor and explore the night market, get a massage and have a few Chang beers! Then when you are done with exploring you step back into the Le Meridien for some nice comforts that remind you of home, but with a Thai flair. Thanks Urusula for a fabulous stay. We will be back soon!
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent hospitality & the location can NOT be beat!

reviews.text: My friend and I spent 4 nights at this hotel. We could not have chosen better. The location, adjacent to the Night Market and walking distance to numerous wats and the remnants of the city walls, was perfect. Many of the rooms have lovely views of Doi Suthep mountain. Adding to our stay was the helpfulness of the hotel's Manager. She greeted us personally when we arrived, offered excellent advice on maximizing our time in and around Chiang Mai and met with us each evening as we planned our touring for the following day. As Starwood members, we were upgraded to the Executive level where we enjoyed breakfast each morning, afternoon tea and evening cocktails. We truly were sorry to have to leave this hotel to continue our travels!
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Superb Service

reviews.text: Stayed here twice within a week. Check-ins were ok but each time we arrived around noon and the room was not ready but it didn't bother us. But during both check-ins there were confusion regarding the kind of room we were after. We wanted twin bedded room but the reservations were always for a king bedded room.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Both times the rooms given were great. Very modern, very clean, nice bathroom. However, the rain shower in the room on our 2nd trip was faulty and couldn't be used. We also stayed at the Le Meridian Chiang Rai druring this trip and in comparison to that resort, the LM CM's room is much smaller. Luggage storage for only 1 bag.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Facilities are great. Nice big lobby with hip and modern background music. The swimming pool was fabulous, but it was too cold to swim in... There are a couple of whirl pools. These at least should be heated. Nice big gym.
reviews.title: super location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great new hotel right next to the night market in Chang Mai. It's location is very convenient for anyone who likes to browse the booths during the evening. Our room was very modern with a flat screen TV and a bathroom that opened up into the rest of the room. Also, the views of the mountains were beautiful. The pool was very nice with a great view of the surrounding area although we never took a dip because it was pretty cold when we were there.
reviews.title: Great new hotel right by the night market

reviews.text: Have stayed a couple of times at Le Meridien Chiang Mai. It's a beautiful property situated in the center of the famous Chiang Mai night market. The rooms are well appointed, wonderfully designed and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet is delicious. Unfortunately it seems the Italian restaurant Favola has fallen victim to the economy and was closed on my latest trip. On a previous trip I had one of the most delicious Italian meals I can remember (and I have lived in Italy!). The gym, spa and pool are fantastic; particularly the view of the mountains from the pool. All in all Le Meridien Chiang Mai is a great value and a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.text: Opening any new hotel in Chiang Mai in the present disastrous downturn in tourism to Thailand is clearly more bad luck than bad planning. In theory, Le Meridien should have everything going for it, especially its prime location right at the Night Market. Fortunately for those who do make the trip to Chiang Mai, like all hotels Le Meridien is offering extremely attractive rates in an effort to fill at least some floors. But it did seem extremely empty during our visit, which was particularly unfortunate because it is unquestionably one of the best hotels in the city.
reviews.title: Excellent new hotel in the city centre

reviews.text: Whilst it lacks the Thai personality of some of the boutique hotels that have sprouted up in recent years, it is an extremely good base for your stay. Le Meridien is developing a funky new brand image worldwide (typified by the new one on Suriwong Road in Bangkok), but the designers of the Chiang Mai hotel have shown considerably more restraint. The large lobby is all cream and light brown marble with some stunning touches - what looked like a 'wall' of lengths of twirled copper separating the lobby from the coffee shop and vast black birdcage motifs on the wall not far from reception. Lifts have the usual Le Meridien jungle noises (very pleasant first thing in the morning) and open on to conventional chain hotel floor layouts. The bedrooms themselves have almost everything one would wish from a 5-star hotel, including an extremely comfortable large bed, crisp white linens, a rain shower and a bath that is more Japanese style than western - i.e. small and deep. But the glass wall enables you to watch television as you soak should you so desire. It was not all perfect, though. The day bed by the window is presumably meant to double as a couch, but is particularly uncomfortable as there is zero back support, even using the cushions. The lack of a DVD player to complement the medium-sized flat-screen TV seems a little penny-pinching, and I felt the temperature control of the air conditioning was a little wayward. But that I put down to teething problems that will quickly be sorted out.
reviews.title: Great hotel on great location in Chiang Mai

reviews.text: The extensive breakfast buffet beats that of any of the dozen or so other hotels I have stayed at in the city. Eggs are, as usual, made to order, but there is also a separate pancake/waffle counter. Yoghurts and sliced fruit salads come in their own little glass pots. My only very minor gripe is that, whilst there are toasters for bread, there seemed no way to warm up the croissants!
reviews.title: Brand new hotel, excellent location, value for money

reviews.text: Great hotel! Great service! Great location! The club lounge manager and team are amazing!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights...so far we had stayed at 3 other 5 star hotels in China and Thailand...so expectations were building...
reviews.title: Funky yet Classy...BEST Assistant Manager!!!

reviews.text: Loved the driveway, a beautiful elephant water feature greeted us at the front, then into the Huge luxuriously lobby. We met and checked-in with the assistant manager who escorted us to the room...she was BRILLIANT, telling us all about the hotel facilties, mapping out all the hot spots to eat and what to order at each restaurant...she was spot on!
reviews.title: Simply in style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: She also advised what prices we should be payinf for the touristy things we wanted to do like a traditional Thai dinner etc.
reviews.title: Delightfully Le Meridien

reviews.text: Pros - EVERYTHING!!! Room, breakfast, staff all amazing! LOCATION was a +++
reviews.title: The safety and comfort of its guests are top priority here

aka: Le Meridien Chiang Mai Hotel Chiang Mai
description: The ideal destination for savvy travellers who enjoy the mixture of Le Meridien's European heritage and local Lanna style to deliver a contemporary cultural experience. The hotel's 383 guestrooms, overlooking Doi Suthep Mountain range, are equipped with broadband internet and offer a modern entertainment experience centered on a high-definition LCD television. A perfect location adjacent to the famous night bazaar will ensure guests encounter the vibrancy + energy of Chiang Mai, just at their doorstep.
